contentrichtext.text: {{ref improve|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox Christian leader |name =Volodymyr Sabodan |image =Митрополит Владимир (Сабодан).jpg |church = [[Ukrainian Orthodox Church (Moscow Patriarchate)]] |archbishop_of = [[List of Patriarchs and Metropolitans of Ukraine|Metropolitan of Kiev and all Ukraine]] |elected=May 27, 1992 |predecessor = [[Patriarch Filaret (Denysenko)|Filaret Denysenko]] |successor= incumbent |ordination=June 15, 1962 |consecration=July 9, 1966 |consecrated_by=[[Pimen I of Moscow]] |birth_date={{Birth date and age|1935|11|23|mf=yes}} |birth_place= Markivtsi, [[Khmelnytskyi Oblast|Khmelnytskyi region]] }} '''Metropolitan Vladimir''' ('''Volodymyr'''; secular name '''Viktor Markianovich Sabodan''', {{lang-ru|Виктор Маркианович Сабодан}}, {{lang-uk|Віктор Маркіянович Сабодан}}, born November 23, 1935) is the head of the [[Ukrainian Orthodox Church (Moscow Patriarchate)]] (UOC-MP). Metropolitan Volodymyr's official title is : ''His Beatitude Vladimir, Metropolitan of Kiev and all Ukraine''. As head of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church (Moscow Patriarchate), he is the head of the only [[History of Christianity in Ukraine|Ukrainian Church]] inside Ukraine to have [[Canon law|canonical]] standing (legal recognition) in [[Eastern Orthodox Church organization|Eastern Orthodoxy worldwide]]. ==Early life== Viktor Sabodan was born in a peasant family in [[Khmelnytskyi Oblast|Khmelnytskyi region]]. In the late 1950s and early 1960s he studied at [[Odessa]] and later [[Leningrad Theological Seminary]]. In 1965 he completed the post-graduate course at the [[Moscow]] Theological Academy and was appointed Rector of the Odessa Theological Seminary and elevated to the rank of [[Archimandrite]]. In 1966 he was appointed Deputy Head of the [http://www.rusdm.ru/en/index.php Russian Orthodox Ecclesiastical Mission in Jerusalem]. ==Episcopacy== In 1966 he was appointed [[Bishop]] of Zvenigorod. His episcopal consecration was conferred on July 9, 1966 by [[Pimen I of Moscow]] in the [[Trinity Lavra of St. Sergius]]. In 1969 he was nominated Bishop of [[Chernihiv]] and temporary administrator of [[Sumy Oblast|Sumy]] [[Diocese]]. On September 9, 1973 he was elevated to the rank of [[Archbishop]] of Moscow Diocese and Rector of the [[Moscow Theological Academy and Seminary]]. On July 16, 1982 he was appointed to [[Rostov-on-Don]] Diocese and elevated to the rank of Metropolitan. From 1984 he was Patriarchal [[Exarch]] of Western Europe, and from 1987, a permanent member of the [[Holy Synod]], Chancellor of [[Moscow Patriarchate]]. In 1992, he was elected by the [[Kharkiv]] Council of the [[Ukrainian Orthodox Church (Moscow Patriarchate)|Ukrainian Orthodox Church]] as Metropolitan of [[Kiev]], and Primate of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church. Later than year he was enthroned as [[List of Patriarchs and Metropolitans of Ukraine|Metropolitan of Kiev and all Ukraine]], replacing [[Patriarch Filaret (Mykhailo Denysenko)|Metropolitan Filaret]] who was excommunicated for participating in schismatic activities. He is the author of numerous research papers on theology, the majority of which were included in the six-volume edition of his works published in 1997–1998. Metropolitan Volodymyr enjoys singing and collects recordings of Ukrainian folk songs as well as stamps and postcards. He has no objections to a good meal. In January 2008, Metropolitan Volodymyr performed the service of consecration of the altar and temple in [[Verkhovna Rada]] of Ukraine.<ref>''"KYIV.
